intro: Anisotes trisulcus subsp. webi-schebeliensis, commonly known as the Schebeli anisotes, is a member of the Araceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its broad, arrow-shaped leaves and striking inflorescence. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its flowers are small and clustered, often surrounded by a modified leaf called a spathe. This subspecies is native to parts of Central and Eastern Africa, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
